For some reason, this player separates tracks in an album out by Artist in the ALBUM view. So for a compilation or soundtrack, you might have 15 separate Album entries with the same album name and art for each differing artist in the album. Not intuitive and makes it so you can't queue the entire album. I can get around this by changing the tag artist to "Various Artists" on each of these types of albums, but I do not like losing the artist information.

A good ad-free and no purchases music player. The only problem I've had with it is sometimes when I open the app it will permanently change a song's title to be in kanji in the list. Not proper kanji, but each kanji corresponding to a letter in the alphabet. Makes it a little harder to decipher what the song is at a glance and trying to reach me improper kanji, but doesn't impact the file or audio quality at all.

Best music player on the app store by far. My only problem with it is my playlists keep getting deleted somehow. Not sure if it's due to the app or my phone, but i don't have any cleaning apps installed.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, the self-deleting playlists is a known problem shared by all the players that rely on Android's mediastore to store them (Shuttle, Vanilla, etc). It is actually Android's fault for randomly deleting playlists from the mediastore. That being said, I am considering switching to a standalone database to save them. Thanks for the review, Adrien

---NOTE--- This app is a FORK of Phonograph but it has the pro features by default. It's not a copy. The whole POINT of this app is to be a fork of the original Phonograph code but with the pro features for free. This is allowed by the GNU General Public License which Phonograph and Vinyl are under.

Thank you so much for uploading to Store. I was tired of downloading apps from f-droid. Above all thanks for this great fork.  EDIT: By the way, you can just short the icon label and title names like just "vinyl" or something like that. Many launchers hide the long icon name, which looks odd.
